turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: This place don't seem real popular with the brothers.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: My kind of place. I always liked country boys.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: That wasn't necessary, buddy. I got this under control.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Some of us citizens are with you all the way, Officer.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You made that move, huh?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: While you're at it, You can give me the switchblade, too.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: There.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Must be billy's girl.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Come on.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Let's go.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Wait a minute.  Maybe these ladies would like to go a few laps with us.  How about it? I been nearly three years in prison and...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: This sucks.  A maniac gets hold of my gun and goes all over the streets killing people with it. So, instead of me being where I oughta be, which is in bed giving my girl the high, hard one, I'm out here doing this shit, roaming around with some overdressed, charcoal-colored loser like you.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You wanna leave, man?  Let me take care of Ganz all by myself.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You?  Don't make me laugh.  You can't take care of shit.  You've been dicking me around since we started on this turd-hunt.  All you're good for is games... So far, what I got outta you is nothin'...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I'm impressed with you too, Jack you did a real good job of busting up a couple of dykes bedded down for the night.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Luther knew more than he told me and so do you...Now you better tell we what the fuck this is all about.  I gave you 48 hours to come up with something and the clock's runnin' ...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Maybe I don't like the way you ask.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Who gives a Goddamn what you think? You're just a crook that's got a weekendpass ... You're not even a name anymore. Just a spear- chucker with a Goddamn number stenciled on the back of his prison fatigues...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, right.  You want to try again?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Naw, you'd just call your pals back to bail you out one more time.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: They saved your ass, convict.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: One thing's for sure, Jack. That's how you'll tell the story.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I been waiting a long time for some money.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: How much?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Half a million.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Jesus.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Just tell me about the money.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Me and my bunch hit a dealer in the middle of a sale. It's the kind of money nobody ever reports stolen. I was sittin' pretty, livin' in the high cotton, then somebody fingered me for another job. ... Some psycho who's out there capping people with some cop's gun.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: He's after your money.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You catch on real fast...Okay, Jack, let's talk deal. How much of my money you gonna let me keep?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: We split 50-50?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Not likely, convict.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You gonna let me keep any of it?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Depends on how things work out. I believe in the merit system. So far you haven't built up any points.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Where's the money?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: In the trunk of a car.  A lot better than under a mattress, right?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Right, partner.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Get this. We ain't partners. We ain't brothers. We ain't friends. If Ganz gets away with my money, you're gonna be sorry we ever met.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah.  Right.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Where's the goddamn car?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You're a real case, you know that, Jack?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: This'll show you how smart I am. I got it parked.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: ...For three years?  Let's hope it wasn't a tow-away zone.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You just drove by it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You son of a bitch. You knew where the money was all along and all we had to do was come here and wait. I almost got my ass blown off twice tonight for nothing.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I wasn't sure the money was still there until we saw Luther. You almost got your ass shot off for nothing once, not twice, Jack.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You took a big chance, leaving this here all this time.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Not really.  I figured Ganz was put down for a long time.  And I knew Luther would never job me on his own.  He's too chickenshit.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Guess what?  Luther just got in line.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Musta got some primo bondsman.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Jesus Christ.  That's a disgrace The guy pulls a gun on a cop and he's out in 24 hours.  I tell you some of the courts these days are just a fucking revolving door.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Jesus Christ, look at all the dust on my car...why in the hell don't he take it to a car wash?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Didn't know you darker people went in for foreign jobs.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I had no choice. Some white asshole bought the last piece of shit skyblue Cadillac.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You'd think the guy'd be smart enough to know he was being tailed.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Tryin' to save his girl, man. He's in another world.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: If I was his size and had Ganz on my ass, I'd  just leave town.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I'm tellin' you the man's in love... he wants to be a hero for his girl.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Oh, yeah, does bein' in love make you stupid?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I suppose you'd never be like Luther and let a woman get to you...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I let women get to me.  The quest for pussy is the meaning of life ... I got my own personal philosophy about 'em.  Keep women separate from guns, money and business ... women are for spending money.  They got nothing to do with helping you make it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: That ain't philosophy.  That's common sense.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Say, do you always work people over like you did Luther?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: If they don't tell me what I need to know...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Doesn't it get... Tiring?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'm not in this 'cause it's fun. I'm not into hitting guys 'cause it makes me feel good either... I do it 'cause it works-...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You got a very depressing view of life, man... you gotta smile once in awhile...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Maybe Luther hopes Ganz'll give him a piece of your money...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: If he's hoping that then he's dumber than I think he is, which would be amazin', cause I already think he's real dumb.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: A long time agb Luther must of got the shit beat out of him so bad it just rattled his brain ... that would account for him making so many wrong moves in a row...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, it doesn't look like he's gonna make it as a dangerous tough guy...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You know, I'd be embarrassed if I let my wheels go the way you've done with this job.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What you don't understand is, I don't give a damn about how this thing looks.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: No class...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Class isn't somethin' you buy, punk. Look at you, five hundred dollar suit and you're still a lowlife.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: We're getting too close ... Cates, what's the matter, you been takin' dumb pills?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, most cops are pretty dumb... But since you're the one that landed in jail what's that make you?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: That was in style a couple years back, man.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Right. if you ever switch from armed robbery to pimping, then you're all set.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Bullshit. Then i'm staying with the money.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You stay with me...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: No way...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Hey, Jack, how ya doin'? What took you so long to call, man? I been waitin' ... I'm at Vroman's up in the Fillmore. Yeah, Vroman's... 'Course you don't hang out here; it's for the brothers.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'll be there in a minute. You don't move your ass, right?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Where's luther?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Be polite. Say hello.  This is Candy.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hello. And goodbye.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What about Luther?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: What about Ganz?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: We missed.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You missed ... Luther took a taxi to the hotel across the street. Made a phone call.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Maybe we should pay Luther a visit.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Let him get some sleep.  He's going to need it.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: They must have set up a meeting for the morning; Luther left an 8 am wake-up and put up the "Don't Disturb" sign.  He's trading his girl for the money.  All we have to do to grab Ganz is not go blind.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: So you took the rest of the night off...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Tell me something.  Why didn't you just take the money off Luther and split?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Forget it. I want Ganz as bad as you do and I got some other news for you...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I don't know why, but I'm going to let you keep it. Maybe because you told me you had it, or maybe just because I'm too tired to argue...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You sure that's the reason?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Thanks for callin' in... and I guess Maybe... Look, I'm sorry I called you Watermellon nigger... those kinds of things. I was just leanin' on ya, doin' my job.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Bein' good at your job don't explain everything, Jack ...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah. Guess not.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, I see her.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I can just take her right across the street to Luther's hotel.  All I need is some money for the room.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: That was quick.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: When you been in prison three years, it don't take long. Let's go.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Why?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Luther's on the move...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Notice something funny about that bus?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah. It missed the last four stops.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Hey, how'd my car get here?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I had it impounded.  Come on, we'll use it for haulin' you back to the slam.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Back to jail in my own car.  Ganz got away. Got all my money. It just don't seem right.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I don't know about you, but I could use a drink... I'll buy you one.  It'll be my good-bye present.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Sorry we didn't do better, Jack. I feel like I let you down.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Naw, you didn't let me down.  It was a long shot all the way.  We gave 'em a good run at it.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Yeah, but we didn't get 'em.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: It's late, they're closing...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Don't worry about it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, well the only woman of the Indian's we ran into was shacked up with her dyke girlfriend.  I guess she went with him before she came outta the Closet ... They both looked mad enough to kill him...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Yeah, too bad.  They were real nice lookin' too...In bed together, hardly any clothes one watching TV...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Do I get to kiss her too?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: If she's right, and if you don't screw up.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: What if your girl's theory turns out to be bullshit?  I mean, they could be in Rio de Janeiro.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I've got to play it rough with them. If they know anything, I'm gonna know it.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Hey, there she is...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Whatever play I maker just back me up.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: If we run into Billy first, let me try and talk him in.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Sure, I'll give you a shot at it, but Ganz is mine.  You know, that big Indian plays it for keeps...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Yeah, and I know Ganz sure ain't no sweetheart... I wouldn't like it if this partnership ended before it gets started.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Partnership?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Well, you got to admit we come a long way.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You okay?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Yeah.  But I wasn't there for a second.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You did pick a real strange time to go and be brave all on your own...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Okay, reggie, start bustin' my chops... Tell me how great you were with that chick.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Hey, Jack, real men don't have to go in for that macho bullshit ... but I was fantastic.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Wait a minute, Cates.  I've been waitin' three years for that.  I don't think it's fair, man. What about the merit system.? You were gonnna give me a few thousand.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: There's nothin' to talk about.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: It's your money.  It'll be here in six months when you get out.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: And you're tellin' me you don't want any of this cash?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: That's right. Not my style, Reggie..

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You are an awesomely weird cop. Sure wish there were more like you runnin' around out here.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: No, you don't. If I ever get word of you steppin' over the line again, I'm gonna ventilate that suit of yours.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Spare met Jack. I'm into legit investments from here on in.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: No trouble, Jack. But, listen, suppose I stay a crook?  Where'd you get the idea that you could catch me?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I want to be left alone on this one. Algren was killed with my gun.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Yeah, I read the report...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hey, the bastard's got my gun.  I want it back.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Jack, come on, there is an official department policy about cop killings. Cop killers represent a special priority because any man crazy enough to kill a cop is a greater threat to an unarmed civilian... In other words, we can't seen like we're in the revenge business... I know, we all know the truth's a little different.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah...

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Anthing botherin' you besides losin' your gun?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah.  It bothers me when cops get hurt while I'm makin' a play. I don't like it.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: You might be more of a team player and a little less of a hot dog on this one, Jack.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Being a hot dog's worked pretty well for me so far... Besides, I got a lead...

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Okay.  You're not a team player. You gotta do things your own way. Fine.  Nail this guy and make us all look good.  But you better watch your ass.  If you screw up, I can promise you, you're goin' down.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You really know how to send a guy out with a great attitude. He starts to go.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Jack?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Try not to get your ass shot to pieces. We got enough dead cops on this one.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'll keep it in mind.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: What the bell happened?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I lost them, that's what happened.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: How did they get away?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: They ran.  As fast as they could. Caught a train.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Which one pulled the trigger?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: The Indian.  I was about 30 yards away.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: You couldn't get to him?

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: What a screw-up.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Right.  I screwed up.  I fucked up. I messed up.  Anybody could have done better, especially you. I bet you're real good at hitting targets through crowds.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Don't duck the bullet Cates. Why didn't you call in for backup instead of makin' a grandstand play?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I didn't have the time.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Too bad, it would've covered your ass.  Now you're in the shit and so's the department. In case you haven't noticed, this wasn't our finest hour... I told you everyone was watchin' on this one. Maybe you better start thinkin' about writin' tickets off a three wheel bike.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: He's got more brains and more guts in one corner of his asshole than any cop I've worked with.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Just cause you say it with conviction don't mean shit to me... How you gonna take to a pink slip, huh?.

turns.speaker: HADEN
turns.text: Where the Christ do you think you're going?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'm taking my prisoner back to jail.

turns.speaker: YOUNG COP
turns.text: That's what you say, Cates...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: YOUNG COP
turns.text: But that's what you say about all of us all the tine ... we're always the ones fucking up when you tell it...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: The truth hurts, doesn't it, buddy?

turns.speaker: YOUNG COP
turns.text: Somebody steals your gun, you're supposed to file a report.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Are you gonna tell me about police procedure?  Do me a favor, don't give me a bunch of crap.

turns.speaker: YOUNG COP
turns.text: I guess when two cops die on account of your fuck up you want to keep it as quiet as possible...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Is that what this guy Ganz had in the hotel?

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Every last bit of it.  The big guy's room was empty.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'll help you out.

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: This guy must have had a .44 like yours, Jack. Now he's got yours.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Shit.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Billy Bear...

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Backup man from the East Bay. Worked with Ganz a few years ago and sprung him from the road gang.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Who are all these?

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: They all pulled a bunch of jobs with Ganz about four years ago.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Wait a minute, wait a minute... who's this?

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Uhh ... Wong, Henry Wong.  He was in on the same job.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Tell me that's not the same guy.

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Hey ... Dick Tracy.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I think I wanna have a discussion about it with any of the ones still walking.  Can we find them?

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Here's the file. Cates checks the file.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: One of  em's in the slam.

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: You look awful.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: So do you...been a long day.

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Long night, too, from what I heard ... Word's going around that in addition to losing Ganz for the second time, and in addition to Haden busting you back to Patrolman, some jig beat the crap out of you.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Aw, bullshit, you heard wrong.

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Doesn't look like it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Nothing came in for me yet?  No calls?

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Bullshit red tape.

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: I'm heading out. How about you?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I got to wait for a call.

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: Okay.  See you in the morning... you know, you ought to get some rest...

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: I almost forgot.  That pal of yours from the Vice Squad wants you to call him.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Jesus Christ.  Why the hell didn't you tell me before?

turns.speaker: KEHOE
turns.text: I'm not paid to take your personal calls.  He was in some bar. .. off duty.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: A cop...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I sure ain't his fairy godmother... now I'm looking for Ganz...where is he?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Haven't seen him for years. That's the truth.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You just took a shot at me, asshole. I think you do know where he is.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Who gives a fuck what you think?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Ganz and Billy got my girl, Rosalie.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I think I met her.  Now tell us something we don't know, like where they stashed her.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I don't know.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: He ... he wants me to help him skip town.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: When? How?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I dunno ... he's gonna call me...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What am I wanted for?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I don't answer questions, I ask 'em...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I don't think your gun's loaded...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: This is a .44 Magnum, the most powerful handgun in the world. You gotta ask yourself just one question. Are you feelin' lucky?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I still don't think it's loaded.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hey, you're right.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You're hopeless.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: That's the way I see it, too.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm all wet.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What's wrong with that?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: A guy in the bar called me a dumb bitch today.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What'd you do?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Irrigated his face with the shot of J and B I'd just poured him. Then I tried to deck the sucker.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I guess he got the message...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Then I sit back and I think, I mean, who's to say I'm not a dumb bitch.  I work in a bar, right? I can't read a list of my academic credentials to every booze-hound that comes in the place... You are what you do...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Positive self-image problem all over again ... You are who you decide you are unless you're the type that lets assholes decide for you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Aren't you the one that thinks all psychotherapy is bullshit?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I do think all psychotherapy is bullshit. But just because I think it's bullshit doesn't mean I don't know something about it.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: If this is your idea of sympathetic interest in my problems, I'll take brutal indifference.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hey, you know what I really think?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Tell me--I'm dyin' to hear it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I think you're ashamed to tend bar which is sad because you look great in that outfit they make you wear... You pull down four bills a week which is damn good, and you mix the best Pina Coladas I've ever had... I think that if you need bigger and better things ... then go for em.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You know, if you let me come over to your place once in a while, you could put on a clean shirt in the morning.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What makes you think I have any clean shirts at my place?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Maybe you ought to buy me one.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Maybe I would if I knew when you were coming back.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: That's a fairly crummy way to start a morning.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Maybe I got a fairly crummy day ahead.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Maybe that makes a nice excuse.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Maybe you don't know what the hell you're talking about.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: When you start with that attitude... it's like I don't know who you are.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What do you want to know?  What difference does it make?  I'm the guy in your bed the last three months.  I make you feel good. You make me feel good.  What the hell else do you want from a guy?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I wish you'd stop trying to make me mad so I won't care for you... I wish you'd give me a little more of a chance.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You know something, Jack, you really are hopeless.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: That's the way I see it, too.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Call me later.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You sure you want me to?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Yeah, for some reason, I'm sure...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Thanks for the coffee.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I think you forgot this. Hands him his wallet and badge...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Guess people ought to know who I am...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Great place for lunch.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, one of my favorites.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You made the front page.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, Guess it must have been a slow news day...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Jack, are you okay?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Sure, okay, fine, no problem... See, there's this kid in jail ... First thing I got to do is go up and see what he knows ...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Look, spare me the macho bullshit about your gun...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Bullshit?  I'll tell you about bullshit.  My gun's a real weapon in the hands of a real maniac who knows how to use it.  It isn't my macho bullshit that's killing people, my gun is ...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Look, Jack, if you make everything your personal responsibility, you'll turn into a bad cop.  It's not a practical way to function...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I didn't get burned, two cops did. Listen, I'll tell you about personnel responsibility.  I like to get the job done right.  And if I don't get my job done right... I'm for shit.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Here it comes again ... the sacred job...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: That's right.  I'm not like you. I'm not gonna sit on my ass wondering what's right and what's wrong... There's a psycho out there killing people with my gun and I'm gonna get him.  Because it's my job. And if you don't get that...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I get that. The job first. Everything else, especially me, second. I get it. I don't like it.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Just one.  Some lady called.  Said she's a little hot-headed sometimes... But she still wants her occasional roommate. She'd like to talk it over after she gets off work tonight... if it's humanly possible....

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Elaine, look, I'm in the middle of sone stuff right now... I'm not gonna have time to come by. I don't know when I can get there.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Listen, Goddamn it if you think I'm happy about it, you're nuts. I just gotta take care of a few things, okay?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: This is not the way people who care for each other are supposed to behave.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I'm at work, asshole.  Where else?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Elaine! I... I'm sorry... I was expecting somebody else... police business.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: No wonder you're so popular.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: No, it's I'm just surprised you called.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: So am I.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: The number ... what's the Goddamn number?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Jack?  What was that?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Elaine, I gotta put you on hold...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Jack, wait...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Just a second, that's all!

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hi, it's me...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Fuck you.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Hey, I don't believe it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hiya, kid.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I ought to have you and your friend thrown out...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Don't.  We've had a hard night.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: I can see that.  Pardon me for saying so, but you look like shit.  What happened?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: We and my pal here have been taking it on the chin for the last few hours...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: You real down?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I've been better...Dead end.  No Ganz, no Indian.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Nothing.  No sign of Ganz.  No sign of the Indian.  Airport's clean.  Train station. Bus station.  Docks... Shit...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Ganz is going to be hard to track. Just a pure schizo ... wires all crossed... totally without any pattern... kill anybody... The Indian... himself... anybody...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: How do you know?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Jack, it's all over the papers. He's an obvious type.  But this Indian...

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: What makes you think they were lesbians, or as you so quaintly put it, dykes?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Come on, they were a little old for a slumber party.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: It might pay to reexamine a few of your more primitive notions.  I was in bed with a girlfriend watching TV last week, Jack, and one thing we know about me is I happen not to be a lesbian ... Now, if this Indian's girlfriend got upset when you came looking for him, it could just be she's still vulnerable to him.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: So what?

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: When a guy hurts you, then comes back bleeding on his hands and knees, who knows, he might just be irrestible.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hey, Come on, shrink time's over. They wouldn't go see some old girlfriend.

turns.speaker: ELAINE
turns.text: Oh, yeah, well look where you came when you were down and out.
